intro: Sanicula hermaphrodita, commonly known as the common sanicle, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Sanicula hermaphrodita is a perennial herb that often grows in moist, shaded woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an important part of the ecological diversity in its native habitats.
